q: Before operating the vehicle, the driver should:

option.a: review the last vehicle inspection report
option.b: should not review the vehicle inspection report and immediately try to find any vehicle defects
option.c: rely on the last vehicle inspection and skip the pre-trip inspection

q: You should reject a vehicle until which of the following gets rectified?

option.a: Faulty headlights
option.b: Faulty windshield wipers
option.c: Faulty flashers

q: Skids caused by acceleration can usually be stopped by:

option.a: coming to a complete stop.
option.b: taking the foot off the accelerator
option.c: applying the brakes firmly

q: Effects of distracted driving include:

option.a: incorrect inputs to the steering
option.b: improved reaction time
option.c: increased following distance

q: Which of these is true about the radiator shutters and the winterfront?

option.a: If the winterfront is left open, the engine may overheat
option.b: You should make sure the winterfront is closed tightly
option.c: You should remove ice from the radiator shutters

q: You should check air pressure and temperature gauges:

option.a: at the end of each trip.
option.b: as often as is practical
option.c: at the beginning of each trip

q: You should signal your intention to turn at least ____ before turning or changing lanes.

option.a: 250feet
option.b: 100feet
option.c: 50feet

q: To avoid becoming a distracted driver you should:

option.a: plan your route before you begin driving
option.b: clear the vehicle of any unnecessary objects
option.c: avoid typing or reading a text message on a mobile device while driving

q: What is an important thing to remember about emergency braking?

option.a: The more heavily loaded semitrailer trailer should be in the rear
option.b: You should never use stab braking
option.c: Pushing down on the brake pedal as hard as you can will only keep the wheels locked up and cause a skid
option.d: Your natural response (hitting the brakes) is never the right solution

q: When checking the steering system for defects, you should look for:

option.a: cut or cracked valve stems
option.b: missing or broken leaves in any leaf spring
option.c: bent, loose, or broken parts, such as tie rods.

q: How should you apply the brakes when going down a steep downgrade?

option.a: Apply the brakes when you reach the bottom of the downgrade
option.b: Apply the brakes whenever you reach your safe speed, until your speed has been reduced to 5 mph below your safe speed
option.c: You should not brake, and only use engine braking to prevent brake failure
option.d: Apply the brakes as hard as you can without locking the wheels

q: You must have at least ________ tread depth in every major groove on front tires.

option.a: 4/32 inch
option.b: 1/2inch
option.c: 2/32inch

q: When should you inspect your vehicle and cargo?

option.a: Before and during a trip
option.b: Before and after a trip
option.c: Before, during and after a trip

q: Before transporting a sealed load, you must check that:

option.a: the load is properly secured
option.b: the seal on the load is secure
option.c: the placard numbers and the seal numbers match

q: Most hydraulic brake failures occur for one of two reasons, one of which is:

option.a: loss of hydraulic pressure
option.b: relying too much on the engine braking effect.
option.c: driving in cold weather

q: If the vehicle ahead of you is smaller than yours:

option.a: it will take the same amount of time to stop
option.b: it can probably stop faster than you can.
option.c: it will usually take longer to stop.

q: What three things add up to total stopping distance?

option.a: Reaction distance + viewing distance + braking distance
option.b: Reaction distance + braking distance
option.c: Braking distance + stopping distance
option.d: Perception distance, reaction distance and braking distance

q: To make an emergency using the stab braking method, you should:

option.a: apply firm pressure to the brake pedal and hold for 6 seconds, then pump the pedal three times
option.b: fully apply the brakes until the wheels lock up, then stay off the brake until the vehicle has slowed down.
option.c: apply the brakes as hard as you can without locking the wheels
option.d: apply your brakes all the way, release the brakes when the wheels lock up, and apply the brakes again as soon as the wheels start rolling

q: Hydroplaning:

option.a: is less likely if tire pressure is low
option.b: can occur at speeds as low as 30 mph.
option.c: can occur only if there is a lot of water on the road.
option.d: can occur at speeds as low as 10 mph, if there is a lot of wate

q: When you have to back, you should use a helper:

option.a: only when you back up with a trailer.
option.b: only when backing toward the right side
option.c: whenever possible
option.d: when you need to back on a curved path

q: Escape ramps:

option.a: are designed to stop runaway vehicles safely.
option.b: should not be used unless you have already tried all other possible ways to save your vehicle after brake failure
option.c: cannot be used by certain types of heavy vehicles

q: With brake drums, if brakes become too hot:

option.a: your ABS will malfunction
option.b: the brakes will supply too much power to the drive wheels.
option.c: the air compressor will kick on to cool the brakes

q: ABS helps you:

option.a: brake harder
option.b: stop faster
option.c: drive faster

q: Which of the following statements about over-the-counter drugs is true?

option.a: They may affect safe driving ability.
option.b: They are perfectly safe and legal
option.c: They can be used while on duty, as long as you drink coffee to stay awake

q: If you perform the skills test in a vehicle that is not equipped with air brake

option.a: you will be restricted from operating vehicles with air brakes
option.b: you will be required to operate vehicles with air brakes.
option.c: you will be required to operate a CMV without hydraulic brakes
option.d: you will be required to take the tank vehicle test

q: The use of brakes on a steep downgrade is:

option.a: the main braking factor
option.b: much more effective than the engine braking effect.
option.c: dangerous, and should be avoided at all costs.
option.d: a supplement to the braking effect of the engine

q: If you become drowsy while driving, you should:

option.a: open the windows to get some fresh air
option.b: take a break
option.c: drink plenty of coffee

q: When you have to back, use a helper whenever possible. Before you begin backing, work out a set of hand signals that you both understand. It is especially important to agree on a signal fo

option.a: go
option.b: move
option.c: stop

q: Foundation brakes are used:

option.a: only with the right wheels
option.b: at each wheel
option.c: only with the rear wheels

q: Why should you put the starter switch key in your pocket during the pre-trip inspection?

option.a: So no one moves the vehicle while you are inspecting underneath it
option.b: So you don't lose it
option.c: You will need it to inspect the trailer.

q: To test your parking brake, do the following:

option.a: Set the parking brake while going downhill
option.b: Speed up to 5 mph, then set the parking brake
option.c: Speed up to 15 mph, then set the parking brake
option.d: Set the parking brake, and gently pull against it in a low gear

q: A burning tire must be:

option.a: cooled with water
option.b: immediately removed from the vehicle
option.c: covered with cloth

q: If you see a hazard ahead, you should:

option.a: think about the emergencies that could develop and be prepared to take action
option.b: call the emergency services
option.c: come to a complete stop when safe to do so.

q: When the spring brakes are on, you should

option.a: not push the brake pedal down
option.b: press the accelerato
option.c: exceed the posted speed limit

q: Whether or not you load and secure your load yourself, you are responsible for:

option.a: inspecting your cargo
option.b: knowing your cargo is properly secured
option.c: recognizing overloads and poorly balanced weight

q: When should you downshift automatic transmissions?

option.a: When you use the brake pedal during normal driving
option.b: When going up steep grades
option.c: When going down grades

q: To prevent fire, you should

option.a: inspect tires and cargo.
option.b: inspect the electrical, fuel, and exhaust systems
option.c: check that the fire extinguisher is charged

q: When driving trucks with trailers, drivers should:

option.a: make quick lane changes
option.b: push the brake pedal to the floor when braking
option.c: decrease their following distance
option.d: avoid making sudden movements with the steering wheel.

q: To prevent drowsiness before a trip, drivers should:

option.a: get adequate sleep
option.b: inspect the electrical, fuel, and exhaust system
option.c: check that the fire extinguisher is charged.

q: When driving trucks with trailers, drivers should

option.a: make quick lane changes
option.b: push the brake pedal to the floor when braking
option.c: decrease their following distance
option.d: avoid making sudden movements with the steering wheel

q: To prevent drowsiness before a trip, drivers should:

option.a: get adequate sleep
option.b: avoid scheduling trips for the middle of the night
option.c: avoid medications that cause drowsiness

q: You should review the pre-trip inspection report from the last driver:

option.a: It doesn't have to be reviewed
option.b: after each trip
option.c: once a week

q: Air tank drains:

option.a: are used to move air to the brakes.
option.b: should not be used in wet weather
option.c: protect the tanks and the rest of the system from too much pressure.
option.d: are used to remove water and oil from the air tanks

q: When you're in an accident and not seriously hurt, to help any injured parties you should:

option.a: Keep the injured person warm
option.b: Get the injured person to stand up
option.c: Give the injured person a cold drink.

q: To check the automatic transmission fluid:

option.a: you should turn the engine off
option.b: the wheel nuts must be loose
option.c: you must go down grades
option.d: the engine may have to be running

q: To prevent rollover, you should:

option.a: place the cargo near the front of the trailer
option.b: keep the cargo as close to the ground as possible
option.c: place the cargo near the rear of the trailer.
option.d: put the lightest parts of the cargo under the heaviest parts

q: After a tire has been changed, you should:

option.a: stop a short while later and check that the nuts are tight.
option.b: decrease tire pressure
option.c: deflate the tire to 15 psi
option.d: wait at least 30 minutes before driving.

q: The height of the vehicle's center of gravity:

option.a: should only be a concern when driving in high winds.
option.b: should only be a concern when driving a vehicle
option.c: should only be a concern when loading a vehicle.
option.d: is very important for safe handling

q: Anti-lock brakes:

option.a: increase your stopping distance.
option.b: reduce the perception distance
option.c: help you stop faster.
option.d: keep your brakes from locking up when you brake hard

q: Why should you be in the proper gear before starting down a hill?

option.a: it will help you go faster when you reach the bottom of the hill
option.b: changing gears on a hill is illegal
option.c: it will help the vehicle be more stable while turning
option.d: gravity can cause the speed of your vehicle to increase

q: The service line is also called:

option.a: power line.
option.b: cable line.
option.c: brake line

q: The most important reason for doing a vehicle inspection is:
